description.narrative: FSP-Strengthening the protected area network for migratory bird conservation along the East Asian-Australasian Flyway (EAAF) in China

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: Mandatory Indicator 1: Number of direct project beneficiaries (% women), consisting of: a) Targeted communities in demonstration landscapes / PAs: Liaohe River Estuary, Yellow River Delta, Chongming Dongtan & Dashanbao b) Central, provincial, local government and PA staff receiving training (GEF Core Indicator 11) 0 Mandatory Indicator 2: Area of terrestrial protected areas (PAs) created or under improved management for conservation and sustainable use (ha): 1.1 Terrestrial PAs newly created for EAAF-China 1.2 Terrestrial PAs under improved management effectiveness (Yellow River Delta NNR, Dashanbao NNR) (GEF Core Indicator 1) See Annex 11B for baseline METTs. 0 Mandatory Indicator 3: Area of marine protected areas created or under improved management for conservation and sustainable use (ha): 2.1 Marine PAs newly created for EAAF-China 2.2 Marine PAs under improved management effectiveness (Liao River Estuary NNR & PNR, Chongming Dongtan NNR) (GEF Core Indicator 2) See Annex 11B for baseline METTs. 0

comment.narrative: Mandatory Indicator 1: Number of direct project beneficiaries (% women), consisting of: a) Targeted communities in demonstration landscapes / PAs: Liaohe River Estuary, Yellow River Delta, Chongming Dongtan & Dashanbao b) Central, provincial, local government and PA staff receiving training (GEF Core Indicator 11) 0 Mandatory Indicator 2: Area of terrestrial protected areas (PAs) created or under improved management for conservation and sustainable use (ha): 1.1 Terrestrial PAs newly created for EAAF-China 1.2 Terrestrial PAs under improved management effectiveness (Yellow River Delta NNR, Dashanbao NNR) (GEF Core Indicator 1) See Annex 11B for baseline METTs. 0 Mandatory Indicator 3: Area of marine protected areas created or under improved management for conservation and sustainable use (ha): 2.1 Marine PAs newly created for EAAF-China 2.2 Marine PAs under improved management effectiveness (Liao River Estuary NNR & PNR, Chongming Dongtan NNR) (GEF Core Indicator 2) See Annex 11B for baseline METTs. 0

Output 1.1: Critical sites for migratory waterbirds added to the PA system, informed by the development of a systematic PA master plan for the EAAF in China Output 1.2: Flyway conservation strategy and business plan developed, setting out innovative funding opportunities for the expanded PA network across the EAAF in China Output 2.1: National and provincial policy and legislation for wetland conservation strengthened, including an adopted national Wetland Conservation Act and national management policy for wetlands of national importance Output 2.2: Wetland conservation integrated into 14th Five-Year plan and technical guidelines adopted on effective wetland conservation, management and sustainable use by different sectors Output 3.1: Four model PAs for migratory waterbirds established, with development of PA management plans, business plans and multi-sector landscape coordination mechanisms Output 3.2: Wetland and migratory waterbird conservation strengthened through capacity development, introduction of professional competence standards and provision of training modules Output 3.3: Pilot interventions for effective wetland conservation, rehabilitation and sustainable use demonstrated at the four model PAs, in surrounding landscapes, and at critical breeding, staging and wintering sites outside the PA network Output 4.1: Community engagement and adoption of sustainable land management practices, achieving livelihood improvement and reduction of threats to critical wetlands for migratory waterbirds Output 4.2: Sustainable use of flyway wetlands in EAAF China strengthened through civil society engagement Output 5.1: Public awareness on wetland and migratory waterbird conservation raised through targeted outreach and education campaigns Output 6.1: Standardized migratory bird monitoring techniques adopted and data collated in unified database for waterbirds and their habitats in the EAAF in China Output 6.2: Knowledge management coordinated effectively between project sites, across China and with the EAAF Partnership Output 6.3: Monitoring and evaluation (M&E) system incorporating gender mainstreaming developed and implemented for adaptive project management

1. Cooperation Seven institutional contracts with academies and other institutions have been signed in 2021, which will provide strong support for gap analysis for terrestrial and coastal wetlands and other relevant studies in the future. 2. Data Collection, Analysis and Outcomes a) Wetland Protection i. 223 valid wetland gaps questionnaires and other related data had been collected. Based on the data, 3 calculation methodologies were developed and the characteristics of the wetland protection gaps were counted and analyzed. ii. 54 comments and feedbacks for “Wetland Protection Law” were collected, reviewed and integrated into the revision process, which reached a consensus. iii. The evaluation framework and indicator system (incl. 20 indicators), models of small and micro wetland protection have been established, and best practices were summarized and documented. Based on these outcomes, policy advices for small and micro wetland protection and restoration were proposed. b) wetland and waterbird monitoring i. The monitoring data of birds was obtained in Yellow River Delta NNR and Dashanbao NNR. Intelligent monitoring and management system like Wechat APP on “Digital Museum of Bird Species”has been developed. These results will provide the basis for the project’s alternative new PAs and build solid foundation to national PA Integration and Optimization Action Plan. Also, they will be conductive to the achievement of wetland protection goal in 14th Five Year Plan 3. Site-based Demonstration a) Project in four demo sites has been launched and the key project interventions and 2021-2022 priorities were discussed and agreed between demo sites and PMO. 4. Reservation and Restoration The degradation of grassland in Dashanbao NNR, the Shanghai provincial capacity of wetland management and restoration, and the critical wetland of “mangrove” together with the waterbird along the EAAF in China will be benefited through the development of Wetland Protection Programmes. The results will also benefit to local communities and to project output on expansion of the potential wetland PA in China. 5. Public Participation and Knowledge sharing a) The Visual Identity (VI) Manual were developed and Logo was designed b) The project has been reported widely, by international, national and local medias, such as RAMSAR website, EAAFP website and Xinhua News Agency. c) Participation of CBD COP15 in Kunming, communication and education materials were designed and disseminated; the project information were presented and exchanged in the information sharing session, which were highly recognized among stakeholders. d) Over 1,700 children (810 girls) in an international Eco-School participated our World Migratory Bird Day Campaign and 260 participants, including 112 females from local communities & universities were involved in our beach cleaning activity. e) By the end of Nov, the KAP survey plan, questionnaires have been agreed by PMO and research team, the target group will cover government official, academia, NR staff, media, community member and schoolchildren, the online and in person questionnaire will cover over 1,500 and 800 respectively. 6. Training a) PMO staff capacity on UNDP-GEF project management, wetland PA governance has been improved through various training sessions and experiences exchange activities provided by UNDP and other partners. More than half of them were female.
